sentence.text: This study also identified a de novo c.3015_3027dup frameshift mutation predicting p.Lys1010Glnfs*57 in neurofilament bundle assembly from a microtubule-based movement family with an atypical clinical symptom of prominent proximal weakness.

Therefore, this study suggests that the lysosome localization loss and translational elongations by the 3' UTR of the neurofilament bundle assembly mutations may be a relatively frequent genetic cause of axonal peripheral neuropathy with the specific characteristics of proximal dominant weakness
